item.title: This CoD Zombies Loadout is Virtually Unbeatable for Black Ops 6's Reckoning Easter Egg
item.description:
This article contains spoilers for Call of Duty: Black Ops 6's Reckoning Zombies Map.

The final map for Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's Zombies mode has arrived. The latest map, Reckoning, added alongside the release of Season 5, is a sprawling, three-pronged maze built around vertical combat, and it contains what could be the hardest boss encounter in the game so far. In fact, much to the surprise of many Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 players, it actually contains two of them.

Reckoning is the first Black Ops 6 map with a two-sided Easter egg, similar to some of Black Ops 2 ’s Zombies maps. Those sides each offer a unique boss, S.A.M. or Richtofen, depending on which version of the Easter egg they choose. Since each boss has distinct attack patterns, vulnerabilities, and supporting enemies, clearing either of Reckoning’s Easter egg bosses is going to come down to the builds players bring to each fight.

Two COD Black Ops 6 Zombies Bosses, Two Loadouts

The path to overcoming either of Reckoning’s bosses should start on the loadout screen. Tons of loadouts can handle regular rounds, but Reckoning's S.A.M. and Richtofen both require tools that match each boss’s weaknesses. Those tools will naturally look different depending on who players are looking to take down.

That said, Zombies players should make sure to stock up on the best Gobblegums and perk augments. They’re great quality-of-life tools, but the impactful choices come from within the arsenal. For struggling players, or those simply not so sure what to choose, the following loadouts are fine-tuned for damage output, utility, and maximum survivability against either of Reckoning’s final foes, and should make the choice of weaponry a little bit easier.

S.A.M. Boss Fight Best Loadout

S.A.M. is a large, mobile boss supported by relentless zombie reinforcements. Its most dangerous attacks are area-of-effect blasts that force near-constant movement, making mobility-focused firepower essential. An automatic shotgun like the ASG or the Maelstrom, enhanced with attachments that increase movement speed, provides the close-range stopping power needed to shred through both the boss and its minions.

Additionally, the Deadwire ammo mod, with the Big Game and Extension augments, is ideal for this encounter. The parasites that appear during the fight can evolve into Doppleghasts and Amalgams, and Deadwire excels at eliminating them while also delivering powerful crowd control. Its chain-lightning effect turns dense zombie waves into manageable clusters, making it a top-tier choice for train conducting.

ASG Shotgun Build

  • Monolithic Suppressor – Muzzle
  • CHF Barrel – Barrel
  • Ranger Foregrip – Underbarrel
  • Extended Mag 2 – Magazine
  • Commando Grip – Rear Grip
  • Light Stock – Stock
  • Steady Aim Laser – Laser
  • Rapid Fire – Fire Mods

Similar attachments can be applied to the Maelstrom, with performance differences between the two weapons being minimal enough to leave the choice up to preference. As a second, the new Gorgofex Wonder Weapon (particularly the Gorgofex N variant) rounds out the arsenal with strong elemental area-of-effect damage. Aether Shroud is the safest field upgrade for the S.A.M. fight, in both solo and co-op, and pairing it with Burst Dash and Extension augments ensures maximum survivability.

Richtofen Boss Fight Best Loadout

Richtofen is a harder, more agile boss with smaller weak spots and an arena that's constantly restocked with Kommando Klaus mobs. Maintaining distance is paramount, and weapons that combine precision with mobility excel here. The ABR A1 assault rifle, released alongside the map in Call of Duty Black Ops 6 Season 5 , stands out for its ability to hit Richtofen’s vulnerable shoulder areas with good damage while retaining SMG-like movement speed.

The AS-VAL and CR-56 AMAX also make solid alternatives, though the former trades power for speed and the latter sacrifices mobility for raw damage. Cryofreeze with Big Game and Extension augments is the optimal ammo mod for this battle, as Cryofreeze deals increased damage to the Uber Klaus and Kommando Klaus enemies while slowing them for better map control.

ABR A1 Build

  • Monolithic Suppressor – Muzzle
  • CHF Barrel – Barrel
  • Ranger Foregrip – Underbarrel
  • Extended Mag 2 – Magazine
  • Ergonomic Riser – Comb
  • Balance Pad – Stock
  • Fast Motion Laser – Laser
  • Rapid Fire – Fire Mods

For the second slot, the Gorgofex Wonder Weapon, this time in its Gorgofex C variant, delivers exceptional boss damage while offering emergency crowd control. Aether Shroud again proves invaluable, but because of Richtofen’s punishing difficulty spike, the Extra Charge augment maximizes uptime and allows for more frequent escapes from high-pressure situations.

Required For Reckoning: Stims, Semtex, and Spin

Regardless of which build or boss is chosen, there are a few universally essential tools for tackling Reckoning’s Easter egg. Stim shots are invaluable for restoring health during the chaos of either boss fight, allowing for quick recovery after a close call or one of either boss’s devastating AOE attacks. Semtex grenades offer excellent burst damage and are particularly effective against dangerous priority targets like Amalgams or Uber Klaus units.

Additionally, players have the opportunity to craft a scorestreak to bring into the arena with them for either fight. Usually, the Chopper Gunner scorestreak would be the go-to pick, but in Black Ops 6 ’s Reckoning, either boss can actually shoot down the chopper gunner, complete with a new animation. The Death Machine scorestreak can fill in the Chopper Gunner-shaped hole in players’ hearts, however, and it earns its place as a last-resort option by melting through hordes in seconds when the fight threatens to spin out of control.

Reckoning’s bosses are definitely tough, but players should feel confident knowing it’s less about raw skill and more about preparation. The key is in knowing that Richtofen and S.A.M. represent two different types of challenge, meaning it’s all the more important to know beforehand what tools are needed to take them down. With these loadouts, the toughest bosses in Black Ops 6 Zombies can be a surmountable (and repeatable) achievement.

Forced to go rogue. Hunted from within. This is Call of Duty: Black Ops 6.

Developed by Treyarch and Raven, Black Ops 6 is a spy action thriller set in the early 90s, a period of transition and upheaval in global politics, characterized by the end of the Cold War and the rise of the United States as a single superpower. With a mind-bending narrative, and unbound by the rules of engagement, this is signature Black Ops.

The Black Ops 6 Campaign provides dynamic moment-to-moment gameplay that includes a variety of play spaces with blockbuster set pieces and action-packed moments, high-stakes heists, and cloak-and-dagger spy activity.

In a best-in-class Multiplayer experience, players will test their skills across 16 new maps at launch, including 12 core 6v6 maps and 4 Strike maps that can be played 2v2 or 6v6.

Black Ops 6 also marks the epic return of Round-Based Zombies, the fan-favorite mode where players will take down hordes of the undead in two brand-new maps at launch. Post-launch, players can look forward to even more exciting maps and groundbreaking experiences dropping into both Multiplayer and Zombies.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Fans Are Calling This Gameplay Feature the Best New Mechanic in Years
item.description:
The first open beta weekend for Battlefield 6 has only just come to an end, but players are already showering the game's drag and revive mechanic as the best new addition in years. After multiple closed playtests earlier this year, fans finally had the chance to go hands-on with Battlefield 6 over the weekend, and they appear to have come away absolutely loving the high-octane action that the series is well-known for.

The next Battlefield game isn't set to officially launch until October 10, but if its first open beta weekend is anything to go by, the series could be about to blow Call of Duty out of the water for the very first time. While new Call of Duty titles are released annually, Battlefield hasn't been seen since the disastrous launch of Battlefield 2042 in 2021. The shooter received largely negative reviews from both players and critics, mainly due to the technical issues, lack of core features such as the traditional class system and server browser, no single-player campaign, and more. Thankfully, it looks like Battlefield is back with a bang, as fans are already praising some of the newest additions.

Battlefield 6 Fans Love the Drag and Revive Mechanic

Battlefield 6 's first open beta weekend has been a huge success for EA, breaking numerous records for the franchise and receiving tons of praise from players. While there's a lot to love about Battlefield 6 , the shooter's new drag and revive mechanic has become a standout addition. As the name implies, the new gameplay feature allows players to drag their fallen teammates to a safer location and then revive them to get back in the action. It makes for some pretty intense moments, which is likely why fans are praising it so much. A new post on Reddit has garnered well over 10,000 upvotes as poster MaKTaiL calls it the "best new mechanic [EA] has implemented in years."

Although the feature is relatively simple, fans do agree that it adds a whole new level of realism to Battlefield . Reddit user Yadahoom said that the drag and revive mechanic "feels super immersive" to do and see, while also noting that dragging a teammate behind cover serves a tactical purpose, making it incredibly useful. Others seem to agree, with user Sega-Forever stating that it even makes them feel "connected" with strangers. As Battlefield is much more of a team-based game than its competitor, Call of Duty , there's no denying that this is an excellent addition to the series.

Fans continue to show Battlefield 6 plenty of love, but its first open beta hasn't been perfect. Alongside some serious UI complaints, fans have also requested that the "unexpectedly fast" time to death bug in Battlefield 6 be fixed for the next beta weekend. Thankfully, it looks like the team behind the shooter is well aware of the problem, as Battlefield 6 's lead game designer, Florian Le Bihan, has already responded to fans. In a new post on Twitter, the developer requested that fans send any footage of the bug to the studio so they can rectify it as soon as possible.

item.title: What Does the Scout Cannon Do in PEAK?
item.description:
PEAK just got its first major update, and the devs have thrown in a bunch of new items to try out. But the fun (and tricky) part is that you never really know what they will do until you use them. Some, like the Bugle of Friendship, can save the day, while others, like the Blowgun, might end up making life harder for your team.

One of the new items in PEAK 's Mesa update is the Scout Cannon. Like other cannons in PEAK , it’s a traversal item. But how does it actually work? Here’s a guide on how to find the Scout Cannon and what you can do with it in PEAK .

How to Use Scout Cannon in PEAK

Scout Cannon is the latest type of cannon added in PEAK . It allows you to blast yourself or your friends across long distances. Once a scout picks it up, they can aim it where they want. Once you place it, you will have a short moment to jump in before it fires. These cannons can be used more than once, so everyone in your group can take a turn.

The Scout Cannon can be really helpful at times, but it’s not without its risks. You can never be totally sure where it’s going to launch you. The game doesn’t tell you exactly how far or how high it will send you. All PEAK players can do is aim it and hope for the best.

One more thing to remember is that you can’t adjust the angle once you have placed it down. So take a moment to adjust its angle carefully before setting it. If you get it wrong, you could end up landing in a tricky place with nothing to grab onto, and that’s not the kind of adventure you want.

If you want to get the best use out of the Scout Cannon, you should practice with it first. Try launching yourself at different angles and watch where you land each time. After a bit of experimenting, the Scout Cannon can help you reach places that would be tricky to get to otherwise. It won’t launch you across the map, but it can still cover a pretty good distance.

How to Find the Scout Cannon in PEAK?

Finding the Scout Cannon is not hard at all. Fans can find it in random luggage bags scattered around the PEAK world. We tried interacting with a few Ancient Statues but didn’t have any luck. This is probably because statues usually give rare items, and the Scout Cannon isn’t that rare.

item.title: Steam Users Have Until August 13 to Claim Cozy Game for Free
item.description:
Steam users have until August 13 to claim the cozy life sim Summer in Mara for free, thanks to a Fanatical promotion. Released in 2020, Summer in Mara is described as a relaxing single-player experience, and it currently holds a “Mostly Positive” average review score on Steam.

Summer in Mara falls into the cozy farming and life sim genre, making its gameplay comparable to well-known titles like Stardew Valley and Fields of Mistria . Players can plant crops, raise livestock, go fishing, befriend islanders, and sail into the ocean to discover treasures. Even better, Summer in Mara offers over 300 quests to keep fans engaged for many hours.

Free Cozy Game from Fanatical

As part of its Summer Sale campaign, Fanatical is giving away Summer in Mara for free to Steam users. To benefit from this limited-time promotion, players need a Fanatical account subscribed to the website's newsletter and a linked Steam account with at least one previous purchase. The promotion ends on August 13 at 11:00 PM UTC, but as Fanatical notes, keys are limited and may run out before the deadline.

How to Claim Summer in Mara for Free

  • Go to Fanatical's Summer Sale Promotion page
  • Link a Steam account with at least one successful purchase
  • Opt into Fanatical's newsletter
  • Add Summer in Mara to the cart and check out with a 100% discount

Summer in Mara is normally priced at $20 USD on Steam, making Fanatical's promotion a generous offer. Since its 2020 launch, the game has received over a thousand reviews, with nearly 80% being positive. Those unsure if this cozy life sim is for them can try Summer in Mara 's free prologue on Steam and decide to claim it on Fanatical only if they enjoy it.

Developer Chibig, which debuted on Steam with Summer in Mara , has since released other cozy games in the same universe, including Stories of Mara and Koa and the Five Pirates of Mara . Its latest entry in the genre is a 3D open-world adventure called Mika and the Witch's Mountain , which has earned it a "Very Positive" rating on Steam. Fans who enjoyed Summer in Mara are encouraged to explore Chibig's other titles, as they will likely find more games that suit their taste.

Steam users should also check out Fanatical's Summer Sale after claiming Summer in Mara for free because it offers discounts of up to 96% on select games. One highlight of Fanatical's sale is a 79% discount on Hogwarts Legacy , one of the best magic-infused open-world games, bringing its price down from $60 to about $12. Those hunting for the best summertime Steam deals are likely to find one or two titles like this to add to their collections at very affordable, historically low prices.

item.title: This Stardew Valley Farm Setup is Virtually Unbeatable
item.description:
Stardew Valley offers players a wide variety of elements to optimize. Relationships, combat, mining, and foraging are key areas for min-maxers eager to master this classic cozy game. However, most players will discover that their farms are the beating heart of their in-game success. It’s where the bulk of the income is made, your seasonal rhythm is set, and long-term goals come to life. Some players have their farms down to a science thanks to this fact.

For the rest, a farm is more like an experiment. With seasonal crops, decorations, and animals to manage, no two farms in Stardew Valley look exactly alike. But casual players might be surprised to find that a relaxed, hands-off approach can limit what they get from the game. Others simply want to showcase their efficiency by having an undeniably optimized farm. Regardless of where a player falls on this spectrum, one thing remains certain: some farms are better than others, and there’s a farm setup that will make anyone the envy of Pelican Town.

A Forest Map Is the Backbone of an Unbeatable Farm Setup

In Stardew Valley , the best farm is set up in stackable steps. If someone is ever looking at their plot and wonders why money isn’t rolling in faster, or why they’re constantly out of time and energy, it’s not due to there being too many things to do in a day. It might be the layout and planning that’s holding them back.

The truth is, success lies within one of the first choices in the game: the farm map. Specific farm maps in Stardew Valley are better than others for both profit and ease of play, which is true for veterans and newbies alike. One, in particular, stands out as virtually unbeatable: a forest map. The forest farm map is designed for long-term sustainability, minimal daily effort, and substantial year-round income. Unlike beach or hilltop farms that rely somewhat on gimmicks, the forest map lets players maximize the efficacy of their farm.

The Core Strategy for an Unbeatable Farm

This initial setup works because it’s built in stackable phases that never waste a season’s potential. Stardew Valley ’s forest map offers naturally regenerating hardwood stumps, a steady flow of forageables, and pockets of water for fishing while leaving plenty of tillable soil for crops; something that a river map struggles with in comparison. The foundation blends three priorities:

  • Profitability: Foraging makes the forest setup incredibly popular. With mushrooms and weeds that give out a healthy amount of mixed seeds, being on the land itself guarantees a profit. Also, there’s a surprising potential for fishing with enough patience.
  • Sustainability: This map has renewable resources like hardwood that keep producing without replanting.
  • Low Maintenance: This map’s friendly approach to foraging and farming makes it a great map for those wanting to avoid a long grind. This map also does not have sprinkler exclusions like the beach map. Low effort means more energy to spend on other activities, like attending festivals in Stardew Valley .

Sometimes, simpler is better. Unlike some overly complicated farms, this approach strikes a balance between diversity and output, ensuring players never get stuck waiting on a single crop, scrambling to buy seeds in town, or scratching their heads between seasons.

Year-by-Year Breakdown for an Unbeatable Stardew Valley Farm

Year 1: Build the Foundation

The first year sets the tone for everything that follows, so one should focus on establishing basic income streams in Stardew Valley and unlocking key upgrades. The flow goes as follows:

  • Spring : Plant a mix of Strawberries and Cauliflower for high profits, while mixing in Potatoes for quick early returns. Forage every day to boost income and level up skills faster. Save up on hardwood to ensure enough is available when the time comes to build.
  • Summer : Switch to Blueberries for consistent harvesting and Melons for big single-crop payouts. Upgrade the watering can to copper before the season ends.
  • Fall : Invest in Cranberries. Cranberries are a powerful end-of-year crop that can carry the player financially into Year 2. Grow Pumpkins for extra profit and to complete community center bundles.
  • Other Milestones in year 1 :
    • Push to unlock the Greenhouse by completing pantry bundles.
    • Start crafting basic sprinklers, and begin upgrading tools for winter prep.
    • Players should place buildings in green areas. A common complaint about the forest map is that there isn’t enough space for crops. To get around this, players simply need to approach the map with a plan. Place buildings in non-tillable soil.

Year 2: Automate & Expand

Now that the basics are in place, players can streamline their workflow and scale up production.

  • Spring: Focus on Rhubarb (Oasis purchase) and Strawberries inside the Greenhouse for constant output. Upgrade to Quality Sprinklers for near-complete watering automation.
  • Summer: Fill the Greenhouse with Starfruit, one of Stardew Valley ’s top-tier crops, while planting Blueberries outdoors for easy cash. Build Barns and Coops to start producing cheese, mayo, and other artisan goods.
  • Fall: Transition outdoor plots to Cranberries again while building Kegs and Preserve Jars for an artisan empire.
  • Other milestones year 2:
    • Upgrade to Deluxe Barns/Coops
    • Add Bee Houses for seasonal honey
    • Begin using sheds for processing space

Year 3 and Beyond: Perennial Perfection

By this stage, a farm should run like clockwork year-round.

  • Greenhouse & Ginger Island: Plant Ancient Fruit or Starfruit in the Greenhouse and on Ginger Island for year-round harvests without seasonal resets.
  • Profit machines: Convert a significant portion of crops into artisan goods.
  • Other milestones in year 3 and beyond:
    • Aesthetic & Efficiency: Aesthetic Stardew Valley farms are meant for more than just a pretty facade. They prevent the need for micromanaging. Lay down paths to prevent weed growth, organize storage sheds for efficiency, and add decorative elements now that money should be of no concern.
    • Full Automation: Use Iridium Sprinklers for 100% coverage and the Gold Clock to prevent fence decay forever.

With this setup, a farm will essentially run itself, leaving players free to explore, build relationships with Pelican Town villagers, and still make a small fortune without constant micromanaging. It’s a perfect blend of beauty, efficiency, and long-term dominance in Stardew Valley .
